title: Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder, old column names are shown when selecting the dataset
description: When setting an alias for columns in a data set, the expression builder still shows the old column names instead of the new alias names when selecting the dataset.
OB: When selecting the dataset in the expression builder, the old column names are displayed instead of the new alias names that were set.
EB: In the expression builder, when selecting the dataset and double clicking on the first column name, the expected result is that the alias name should be displayed according to scr 78193 in the tracker. However, the actual result is that the original name of the first column is listed below in the expression builder, but the alias name appears above as 'row["column1"]' after double clicking the original name.
SR:
1. Open the expression builder.
2. Select the dataset.
3. Double click on the first column name.
4. Observe that the original name of the column is listed below and the alias name appears as 'row["column1"]' above in the expression builder.
